title.narrative: Enhancing Resilience and access to livelihood Opportunities for Affected Population through FSL and livelihood interventions in Aleppo-Afrin.

description.narrative: The project supports the populations and socio-economic structures in Afrin, Sharan, and Jandairis subdistricts, by enhancing the access to market-based livelihood opportunities to increase access to the public economy-related infrastructure and facilities through integrated agricultural FSL and livelihood prioritized activities under this allocation through supporting 28,111 affected persons (8265 women, 7476 men, 6293 boys , 6077 girls) who will benefit from the activities of this project. The project objectives will be achieved by supporting the wheat value chain in Afrin areas, where the farmers will be supported in the production phase by providing them with seasonal agricultural inputs (fertilizers, irrigation support for the cultivating season 2021-2022 and in the marketing phase as HIHFAD will purchase 1100 MT of wheat from farmers, 640 MT of wheat (192 MT of Durum wheat and 448 MT of soft wheat) which will be processed into 475 MT of wheat flour that will be produced via contracting local bakeries to be distributed as a fresh bread bundles (1 KG) to about 5400 HHs using in-kind modality, this component will have the life-saving theme as it will target the IDPs in camps of the targeted sub-district for 4 months of distribution for 26 days per month through contracting with local bakeries, while the rest of 460 MT amount of wheat will be sieved and sterilized into 400 MT that will be distributed as agricultural input (seeds) for around 1600 farmers (800 in Sharan and 400 in Jandiris 400 in Afrin) in the cultivating season 2022-2023. To ensure integration of all value chain components, the milling and sieving outputs will be used to cover the costs of milling and sieving. These activities will be linked with supporting the existed irrigation System in the area by conducting a light rehabilitation/cleaning of the irrigation canals in Sharan, Afrin, and Jandairis. HiHFAD will invest in capacity building of farmers to enhance their agricultural practices and, eventually, their crops yield through online-training on best agricultural practices. The priority will be given to the vulnerable households from the applicants (Families includes PWD, pregnant, infants, IDPs and families with high number of families member), the selection criteria for the farmers will be: 1. Full official access to land. 2. Land size (in Dunum) between 5 to 10 Dunums. 3. Settled in the relevant location for a minimum of 6 months in case of IDP. 4. Previous experience in relevant crop farming. 5. Access to any irrigation source. 6. Agriculture is the main source of income for the household. The selection criteria for the bread distribution will be: 1. IDPs living in camps. 2. not receiving bread from other actors. 3. families with 4 and less members will receive 1 Bread Bundle BB, and 5 and more members will receive 2 BBs. 4. the camps should be located in our targeted area. The expected bran of the milling of about 640 MT of local wheat is 140 MT, this bran will cover the cost of milling 640 wheat into flour. HIHFAD will announce the project through its public social media in addition to local channels in collaboration with the local authorities, where HIHFAD team will conduct workshops with stakeholders on the community level before starting the implementation of the activities.
